"An achievement that empowers those who earn it. The flavor is like a dream... a powerful personal experience, yet difficult to describe to others."

Overview


In terms of missable achievements, Stardew Valley does not have any. It does; however, contain two mutually exclusive achievements. For more information regarding this please see the permanent choices labeled: "Community Center vs Joja Mart". This can either be handled by backing up a save, and performing both achievements on the same save or by using two completely different playthroughs.

Permanent Choices


Farm Type

With Update 1.1 and after, the first permanent choice the player faces is deciding what type of farm they wish to play on.
If this is your first time playing Stardew Valley and your intentions is to complete the achievements of the game, I would either recommend the standard farm or the forest farm. If achievements are not a primary factor in playing Stardew Valley, feel free to pick any farm you wish.

  • Standard
  • Riverland
  • Forest
  • Hill-top
  • Wilderness
A simple plot of land, with a large amount of open space to design your farm.
Your farm is spread across several islands and scenic riverbanks. Fish are more common here than usual.
The woods limit your farming space. However, the bounty of the forest is nearly at your doorstep...
Rocky terrain and a winding river make it difficult to design your farm. However, a mineral deposit provides mining opportunities.
There's plenty of good land here, but beware... at night the monsters come out.

Skills

In total, there are 5 different skills. For each skill, you are given a route at level 5. Then at level 10, you are given another route based on the route you took at level 5 for each skill. This is merely a warning that the choices you take will adversely affect you future choices. So when the time comes, or now, to check the skill section and determine your routes. My preferences are given below:

Farming: Tiller to Artisan (Helps with money making 'Legend' achievement)
Foraging: Gatherer to Tracker (Helps with artifact for 'Complete Collection' achievement)
Mining: Geologist to Excavator (Helps with artifact for 'Complete Collection' achievement)
Fishing: Fisher to Pirate (Helps with artifact for 'Complete Collection' achievement)
Combat: Fighter to Brute (Personal Preference)

Farming and Combat can be worked around; however, foraging and fishing are highly recommended that you keep them as they are. Artifacts are time consuming to come by, so getting all the help you can get is recommended. Mining on the other hand has ties to minerals with geodes which is recommended, but less so. Geode minerals are less rare than artifacts; however, this still remains a recommendation.

Farm Cave

In order for Demetrius to show up to your farm and present you with the option to do something about the farm cave, the player must earn a cumulative total of 25,000g in earnings. After that, you'll have Demetrius show up to your farm and ask to setup the Farm Cave giving you the option between Fruit Bats or Mushrooms. This choice is permanent so you need to determine which of these you would prefer.

Early game, the fruit bats would prove more useful as growing fruits and purchasing saplings for fruit trees is expensive; however, once you have fruit trees established, the fruits that appear in the cave become less appealing. Mushrooms would take longer to produce as well as the fact that the Secret Woods contains most of these. Now, if you were to select the Forest Farm as your farm, then I would select the Fruit Bats. If you do not have the Forest Farm and want the long term choice, I would pick the Mushrooms.

Note: Both options will grow their respective products out of season.

Community Center vs Joja Mart

The 'Local Legend' and 'Joja Co. Member of the Year' achievements are mutually exclusive. This means that in one save file, you can only do one or the other and not both. Now, backing up a save near the end before you obtain either one of these achievements is a viable method to obtaining both achievements with the same playthrough, but not the same file.
Update 1.1 has made it so that these two achievements are not missable. You will end up with one or the other regardless of how many paths you mix on the way to restoring the town. The achievement that you end up with will depend on which side you complete the final upgrade with.

Each upgrade in the Community Center correspond to each upgrade in the Joja Co. Membership Card.

Community Center

To begin the restoration of the Community Center, simply enter the town between 8AM and 1PM on a sunny day after Spring 5 and you will get a cutscene with Lewis. Here you will also encounter Junimos and in a language you can't read will initiate a quest given to you by the Wizard. This quest will grant you access to the Wizard's Tower as well as the ability to communicate the Junimos.

After that, you can begin with dealing with the bundles. Bundles require you to take certain items, and in some instances quality, and turn them into the community center. This will consume the items. For each bundle the player completes, the player will receive a specific reward and may also receive friendship points with various villagers. If the player completes all of the bundles in one room, then the player will receive a Pelican Town restoration development.
This is considered the "good route".

Joja Mart

To begin the Joja Mart takeover, simply buy the Joja Membership for 5000g from Morris in Joja Mart. Purchasing the membership will replace the Community Center with a Joja Warehouse. After that, simply talk to Morris to purchase Pelican Town developments. It would cost 135,000g to buy all the upgrades.

This is considered the "bad route".

Side Note: While you can start the Community Center route, it is possible to switch to the Joja Mart route before you complete all of the bundles and purchase the Membership. This will save money. However, this only works in that way. Purchasing the membership will effectively close the Community Center and replace it with the Joja Warehouse.

Farm

Your Farm

This is your farm. The appearance of your farm depends on the style you picked when you first started the game.

Inhabitants

Yourself, Your Spouse, Your Children, Your Pet, and Your Steed

Points of Interest

Farm Cave: Located just west of the north exit, the farm cave is a resource designed to either produce fruits or mushrooms depending on the choice you made when Demetrius came by your farm to perform field research with your cave. This event occurs once the players has earned a cumulative of 25,000g.
Greenhouse: Located just southwest of the farm cave, the Greenhouse can be repaired through either the Community Center or the Joja Membership. It allows the player to grow crops out of season, including in winter.
Grandpa's Grave: This grave will hold purpose upon completing Year 2 on the farm. Upon which the candles on the gravestone will be lit. Lighting up all four candles will grant the player the Statue of Perfection which is a great source of iridium.

Exits

North: Backwoods
East: Bus Stop
South: Cindersap Forest

Bus Stop

Bus Stop

This is the Bus Stop. It's most notable function is accessing the Desert.

Inhabitants

Pam (After the Bus is repaired)

Points of Interest

The Bus: The bus can be repaired either through the Community Center or the Joja Membership. See the respective sections as to how to unlock it. Pam is the driver of the bus, and it starts operating at 10AM. The travel fee costs 500g.

Exits

Northwest: Backwoods (Underpass)
East: Pelican Town
West: Your Farm

Backwoods

Backwoods

The backwoods is a shortcut between the Farm and the Mountains. It's also a relatievly good route to take to the mines.

Inhabitants

None

Points of Interest

Underpass: When accessed from the Bus Stop, the player can enter the underpass. Here you can find a panel to place a battery pack to start a questline to enter the Casino inside the Oasis at the Desert.

Exits

East: The Mountains
South: The Farm
Southeast: Bus Stop (Can only be entered from the Bus Stop)

Location

Cindersap Forest

The Forest is home to several things as well as being a great source of wood and foraging.

Inhabitants

Marnie, Jas, Shane, Leah, Wizard

Points of Interest

Traveling Cart: Every Friday and Sunday, the traveling cart will appear north of the lake. Here you will be able to purchase both common and unique items.
Marnie's Ranch: The ranch allows the purchase of animals for your coops and barns.
Wizard's Tower: The Wizard's Tower questline and relationship will eventually grant you the ability to change your character's appearance.
Abandoned House: The player can purchase various hats for the achievements earned in-game. Located just south of Arrowhead island.

Exits

North: Your Farm
East: Pelican Town
South: Sewers (Donate 60 items to the Museum)
Northwest: Secret Woods (Requires Steel Axe or Better)

Pelican Town

Pelican Town

The central hub of Stardew Valley, the player will find everything they need here.

Inhabitants

Everyone else

Points of Interest

Harvey's Clinic: It's healthy.
Pierre's General Store: The local town shop. Sells everything, most importantly backpack upgrades.
Blacksmith: A service to upgrade tools, open geodes, and buy resources
Community Center: A community hub, that's broken. Restoration required.
Museum: Doubles as a library, it hoouses all unique artifacts, minerals, and books.
Stardrop Saloon: A popular hangout spot for friends and for a nice relaxing drink. Contains cooking recipes for sale.
Joja Mart: A chain store.

Exits

North: The Mountains
South: The Beach
West: Bus Stop
Central-South: The Sewers (See Sewers on how to unlock)

The Mountains

The Mountains


Inhabitants

Robin, Demetrius, Maru, Sebastian, Linus, Gil, Marlon

Points of Interest

Carpenter's Shop: Robin's home serves as the Carpenter's Shop where you can purchase furniture, buildings, and upgrade buildings.
The Mines: It's a mine.
Adventurer's Guild: Contains quests for killing monsters within the mines. Accessed by completing the 'Initiation' quest.
Quarry: Contains a hoard of minerals and resources for mining. To access, see the Community Center or Joja Membership section.

Exits

North-West: Railroad
West-North: Backwoods
North: The Mines
South: Pelican Town

The Beach

The Beach

Legend has it if you put your ear into a conch, you can hear the ocean.

Inhabitants

Elliot, Willy, Mysterious Man

Points of Interest

Broken Bridge: Can be fixed with wood. A lot of it.
Fish Shop: Prime place to buy fishing rods and fishing rod accessories.
Mysterious Man: After a marriage candidate reaches 10 Hearts, the player must cross the bridge when raining to find a mysterious man who will sell you the Mermaid Pendant that allows the player to marry. Costs 5,000g.

Exits

North: Pelican Town

Sewers

Sewers

The Sewers is a sewer. Fancy that. In order to access this place, the player must donate 60 unique items to the museum. Gunther will give the player the Rusty Key which will unlock the Sewer from the Cindersap Forest entrance.

Inhabitants

Krobus

Points of Interest

Mutant Bug Lair: After restoring Pelican Town, the player can begin Magical Construction questline with the Wizard. When obtaining the Dark Talisman from Krobus, Krobus will send the player here.

Exits

North: Pelican Town
Southwest: Cindersap Forest

The Railroad

The Railroad

This area will unlock on Summer 3. It's usually accompanied by a large earthquake.

Inhabitants

Nobody

Points of Interest

The Spa: Recovers your energy.
The Train: Occassionally makes it way through Stardew Valley. Sometimes it will drop items.
The Cave: After completing the restoration of Pelican Town, the player can begin the Magical Questline with the Wizard. The cave leads to the Witch's Swamp.

Exits

South: The Mountains

The Calico Desert

The Calico Desert

The Desert is a separate area from Pelican Town, but still within Stardew Valley. The weather here never changes.

Inhabitants

Sandy, Mr. Qi, Others

Points of Interest

The Oasis: A store that offers some exclusive crops and items.
The Skull Cavern: The Mines, but harder.
The Casino: Completing Mr. Qi's quest will grant access to the Casino inside of the Oasis.
The Sand Dragon: The final stage of Mr. Qi's quest, place a Solar Essence here when it's time.
The Three Pillars: Offering a Prismatic Shard here will grant the player the Galaxy Sword. Galaxy weapons will be sold at the Adventurer's Guild afterwards.

Exits

The Bus: Bus Stop
Northwest: The Skull Cavern

Singular Talent
Reach level 10 in a skill.
Master of the Five Ways
Reach level 10 in every skill.

Skills

Experience is gained upon performing an action related to the skill you're leveling up. Level ups only occur when you go to sleep. It's even possible to earn multiple level-ups for the same skill within a single day, especially in farming.

Now to earn experience in each skill, you simply have to perform tasks related to that skill:
Farming: Harvest Crops
Foraging: Forage Items or Cut Trees
Fishing: Fish
Mining: Mine rocks, gems, etc.
Combat: Defeat enemies

Do remember that the choices you make at Level 5 and 10 are permanent. So plan ahead.
  • Farming
  • Foraging
  • Fishing
  • Mining
  • Combat
  • Recommendation
If you're curious as to which skills you should pick, or simply want some explanation as to which ones are good and why, here is my preference:

Farming

Farming is the best method of money making, so this choice will affect how you approach the Legend achievement that requires you to earn 10,000,000g. Now while both are good in price investment, the player cannot abuse sleep spam when doing Rancher plus it's expensive and time consuming for the player to continually purchase additional Coops and Barns to house new animals. Therefore going Tiller at Level 5 is the best choice here. Plus early game, the majority of your profits are going to come from crops until you reach Winter.

Now the next part at level 10, a majority of the crops do not take all that long to grow. The crops that do take forever to grow, such as the Ancient Fruit, Blueberry, Cranberries etc are only hindered by the first growth period. After that, the reproduction period drops off significantly when it regrows making time less of a problem. This makes the Artisan profession much more appealing. This also works in junction with the time skip where you can simply drop off crops into Kegs, Preserve Jars, and Casks to produce artisan goods from crops and increase their value.

Foraging

For Foraging, I would require the player to go for Gatherer then Tracker. Gatherer doesn't really have any influence on this pick, so the double foraged items is merely a side bonus. The important skill here is Tracker which will mark all forageable items on your map denoted by yellow arrows on the edge of your screen. This yellow arrow will also point out any digging points that may yield artifacts which will help the player when dealing with the Complete Collection achievement.

Fishing

For fishing, if you're still worried about artifacts, then the obvious choice here is to go Fisher at Level 5, then Pirate at Level 10. When fishing, the player may encounter a treasure chest and these treasure chests contain goodies including rare artifacts. Due to RNG being the worst factor, it's highly recommended that the player has multiple outlets towards hunting down artifacts.

Mining

Similar to fishing, this skill is also a free choice, but if you're still worried about the Complete Collection achievement, then you'll want to go Geologist to Excavator. The Geologist will give you double gems which is a nice money bonus, but is of little importance in the grand scheme of things. The Excavator skill will increase the chance of finding double Geodes to all four types of Geodes. Geodes are the primary source and in most instances, the only source, of Minerals which is required for the Complete Collection achievement.

Combat

Combat is completely up to the player's style. I can't change the way you play, so picking skills that fit your style is highly recommended here. Just make sure you check out the professions available at Level 10 so you're aware of what you can get. I personally went with Fighter to Brute because I enjoy consistent raw damage and that's what you get with higher base damage.

Greenhorn
Earn 15,000g
Cowpoke
Earn 50,000g
Homesteader
Earn 250,000g
Millionaire
Earn 1,000,000g
Legend
Earn 10,000,000g

Money

Ultimately, making 10,000,000g will take a while and you shouldn't worry about this until this is the last thing on your list. However, I will describe tactics that will help you get the most return for your money.

Farming while Playing

Early game, you'll want to try to focus on purchasing seeds for crops that can regrow. This helps early game as it lowers the amount of money you spend on seeds. Then once you get a larger bank going, you can start focusing on the larger plants whose seeds cost more, but also give a good return on produce.

A good tip to know is that resting in the Spa just north of the Mountains will restore your energy allowing you to water more plants in the same day without the use of items nor sprinklers until you can obtain enough resources to make sprinklers.

Farming at the End

While the pricing for artisan goods as well as ancient fruit wine was lowered, it is still a viable method to earn money. Even more so since you can age products inside casks with the new cellar upgrade for the house. If you're at the end, you should have the cellar upgrade, as well as the greenhouse. You'll also need 116 ancient fruit seeds. This is the maximum number of plants you grow in the greenhouse when accounting for the required number of sprinklers to avoid time wasted by watering plants.
Initially, ancient fruit plants take 28 days to grow, then will reproduce fruit every 7 days. So you will have to harvest crops every 7 days. It also takes 6-7 days to convert fruits into wine, so you will also retrieve all your wine as well. To make wine, you'll need kegs and a minimum of 116 kegs to handle the equal number of produce that gets harvested each week. After that, with the cellar upgrade, you can increase the price of wine by aging it. It takes 14 days to obtain Silver Star, 28 days to obtain Gold Star, and 56 days to obtain Iridium Star. Basic math will tell you that it's impossible to age wine faster than it is to produce wine. It takes 2 weeks to make Ancient Fruit wine. Then it takes at least 2 weeks to improve the star rating. Now the hard part is to have 8 sets of 116 casks, that way each week you will receive a shipment of Iridium Quality Ancient Fruit Wine, which will free up 116 casks for the new batch of 116 Ancient Wine.

Despite a Shed being available, the maximum number of kegs a shed can hold and be interactable is 67. In contrast, the Barn can hold 90 kegs which makes it a better storage option. The cellar can also only hold a maximum of 125 accessible casks (189 total slots). So use buildings to your advantage for storage.

After all that, execution is left. Simply sleep for 7 days straight, harvest your fruit and wine. Place the new fruit into kegs, and place the new wine into casks and then take out the finished aged wine and sell them off. Rinse repeat every 7 days.

Side Note: If your relationship with players is at maximum (8 for marriage candidates/10 for non-marriage candidates), your relationship with them WILL NOT lower over time. Your farm however, will incur some damages over time such as fences, and pathing being broken and weeds growing.

What to do with 10,000,000g?

Visit the Casino to buy the Statue of Endless Fortune. It costs 1,000,000g and produces Diamonds, Iridium Bar, Omni Geodes, Gold Bars, or a Villager Favorite (on their birthday).

A New Friend
Reach a 5-heart friend level with someone.
Best Friends
Reach a 10-heart friend level with someone.
Cliques
Reach a 5-heart friend level with 4 people.
Networking
Reach a 5-heart friend level with 10 people.
Popular
Reach a 5-heart friend level with 20 people.
The Beloved Farmer
Reach a 10-heart friend level with 8 people.

Relationship

Relationship is primarily improved by gifting the villager their preferred items.
Gifting items that are specifically requested by quest (typically by mail) will result in +1 Heart.
Gifting items from the 'Help Wanted' quest-board will result in +150 points.
Loved: +80
Liked: +45
Neutral: +20
Dislike: -20
Hate: -40

denotes that the villager is marriage-compatible. These villagers cannnot exceed 8 Hearts until you proceed with marriage requirements.

Universal

Note: Any entries in universal will be overridden by the character preferences. Universal preferences are a generalization which works for most items and villagers in Pelican Town, but there are exceptions.

Example 1: Gems are considered a Universal Like; however, Amethyst is listed as a "Loves" item for Abigail. So the universal section takes the least amount of precedence.

Example 2: Cooking is considered a Universal Like; however, items suc has Bread, Fried Egg, and Strange Bun are not. This shows that individual placement will override categories in the same area.

Fishing

For the most part, fishing is pretty intuitive. But if you're having trouble, my only recommendation is that you keep the fish at the top of your bobble. It's easier to react to clicking than it is to wait for the bobble to drop then match the speed. So keeping the fish near the top will help provide a buffer for reacting.

Note: The chart below is very self-explanatory; however, below the chart will give tabs to show where the player should be fishing for the legendary fish.

  • Crimsonfish
  • Angler
  • Glacierfish
  • Mutant Carp
Gofer
Complete 10 'Help Wanted' requests.
A Big Help
Complete 10 'Help Wanted' requests.

Help Wanted!

Help Wanted requests are randomly generated quests that appear in front of Pierre's General Store right next to the calendar. For the most part, these are self-explanatory, but the good part that I want to point out regarding this is that any items you give in these quest will have 3x the normal effect to a person's relationship to you than if you were to gift the item without the quest. This will make improving relationships easier, as you do need a large number of max relation villagers.

Now, you get a total of two days to complete the Help Wanted request, and several of them generally involve deliverying items that are seasonal to the current season. Crops requested can be grown that season, fish requested can be fished that season, etc. So, this will also help the player familiarize themselves with the seasonal goods that Pelican Town has to offer.

Polyculture
Ship 15 of each crop.
Monoculture
Ship 300 of one crop.
Full Shipment
Ship every item.

You'll have to reach at least Level 5 of the Mines. After that, you'll get a story quest named 'Initiation'. Complete this quest to gain access to the Adventurer's Guild.

Once you've gained access to the Adventurer's Guild, then there will be a bulletin that gives you the counters for each of the types of enemies you'll encounter shown below. Joja Co. Member of the Year
Become a Joja. Co. member and purchase all the commuunity development perks.

Joja Membership

This achievement is mutually exclusive with Local Legend. Upon purchasing the Joja Membership for 5,000g, the Community Center will be replaced by a Joja Warehouse thus making the Local Legend achievement unobtainable. The best route is to complete four of the five rooms inside of the Community Center, back the save up, and then buy the membership and the final upgrade an obtain the Joja Co. Member of the Year. After that, simply revert the save to your previous and finish the Community Center that way.

Community Center

  • Help
  • Crafts Room
  • Pantry
  • Fish Tank
  • Boiler Room
  • Bulletin
  • Vault
Each tab will correspond to a room inside of the Community Center.
Each section will contain every bundle and an overview of the room: most notably the theme and the reward for completing the entire bundle.
Each bundle will the number of slots you must fill as well as all items that are accepted in the bundle.

While most bundles will require you to get every item listed, there are several bundles that do not require you to do so: such as the Exotic Foraging Bundle. In here, the player has a total of 5 Slots. There are 9 different items that the player can turn into the bundle, meaning four of them are not needed. Also, you cannot turn in the same item in a bundle.

Crafts Room

The Crafts Room is the first room available with bundles. The overall theme of the Crafts Room is foraging.

Completing the Crafts Room will repair the bridge east of the Mines unlocking the Quarry allowing the player to have a concentrated source of minerals.

Graveyard BossFector
Fector's Challenge is by far the hardest achievement in the game.

The drop rate in Journey Of The Prairie King is unaffected by the luck factor of Stardew Valley. So, having a good run will purely rely on RNG in the game.

Since this is a twin-stick shooter, everyone has their own preference in upgrades, so you want to pick something that fits your style of play. My preference is to pickup at least one upgrade into movement speed, so the mushrooms do not have the same speed as you. Then picking up an upgrade each into firing speed and damage before increasing damage to 3 damage per shot. I prefer raw damage. After getting the second damage upgrade, depending on how I feel on my firing rate, I either go for that or the final damage upgrade.

Now for skills, you can always hold one skill in your inventory. Then any other skill you pick up will activate automatically. The nuke is probably a good item to keep on hand due to its ability to get you out of a pinch. Should you become overwhelmed by enemy numbers, using the nuke would clear the map; however, the player should be cautious that any kills with the nuke will NOT produce item drops. So if this is something the player wants to avoid, either avoid picking up the NUKE or using it immediately. Other upgrades you want to hold on hand are the Sherriff's Badge, Wheel, and Machine Gun. These can help immensely clear out areas.

In regards to the environment, once the player reaches the Forest biome, they should be wary of going around the edges of the map. In the Forest biome, Pixies can spawn anywhere on the map and cross over to any section they wish making obstacles useless. This is particularly dangerous when items are dropped along the edge, so be cautious.

Finally, for the boss stages, the Cowboy simply shoots volleys of bullets, so as long as you can dodge his bullets while landing hits on him, he is very easy. As for Fector, he truly is a final boss. He has the wheel upgrade which allows him to fire in all eight directions, plus he begins to summon enemies as his health lowers. During these times, make sure you get rid of the enemies quickly so you can resume focusing on Fector himself.

Full House
Get married and have two kids.

Marriage


Step 1: Pick a marriage candidate. The relationship section will denote anyone who is a marriage candidate with a heart by their name.
Step 2: Get that marriage candidate relationship to 8-hearts.
Step 3: Upgrade your house. This will upgrade your bed from a Single to a Double.
Step 4: Purchase a Bouquet from Pierre and give it to your future significant other.
Step 5: Get your marriage candidate to 10-hearts.
Step 6: Repair the bridge at the Beach (300 wood)
Step 7: On a rainy day, visit the beach and talk to the mysterious man to buy the mermaid pendant for 5,000g.
Step 8: Give you significant other the pendant.
Step 9: Upgrade your house again. This new upgrade will introduce a baby room.
Step 10: Once married, you can increase your relationship with your spouse up to 13 out of 12. Once the 13/12 appears, you will receive a stardrop and eventually be prompted to have a baby.
Step 11: Keep your spouse happy until they prompt you to have another baby.
The Bottom
Reach the lowest level of the mines.

The Mines

To simply put, the player must reach Floor 120 of the Mines located in the Mountains. The mines will be closed until Spring 5 of the first year. Entering the mines will initiate a cutscene with Marlon giving you a Rusty Sword.

Elevator
Every fifth floor can be accessed by the elevator; however, if you die, some of the elevator progress will be lost (up to 11 floors). So if you were to be on the 47th or so floor and die, then you would lose between 5-11 floors of progress and the elevator would not reach the 45th floor anymore. If you lost 11 floors, then your progress would drop to Floor 36, so the elevator would only reach the 35th floor.

Death
Dying in the mines will send you back to your farm. In addition to losing time, the player will also drop various items and money in the mines that will not be retrievable. While tools will be recovered by mail if lost, this does not hold the same for weapons and unique items such as fishing poles. So be careful what you bring into the mines.

Progression
Each floor contains a staircase or ladder that leads to the next floor. In some cases, the ladder is already visible; however, the majority of the time requires the player to either clear out rocks or enemies in order for the ladder to show up. Multiple ladders can show up. Also with Level 2 Mining, the player can craft Staircases using 99 stones which will automatically place one in the desired location.

Maps
While each area is a specific map, the objects that fill the map are randomized as well as the location of the ladder.

Changelog

Note: The changelog will only focus on things that affect achievements.

Update 1.2

  • Crop yields now affected by farming level prior to Level 10.

Update 1.11

  • Forest Farm: Build area increased.
  • Riverland Farm: Panning and Fishing Splash Nodes added.
  • Bushes can now be destroyed with an upgraded axe on the farm.
  • Forest Farm: Forage items can spawn on any grassy area now.

Update 1.1

  • Full House: Shane and Emily added as marriage candidates.
  • New farm types: Riverland, Forest, Hill-top, Wilderness
  • Craft Master: Cask Recipe - Unlocked by upgrading house with Cellar
  • Legend: Iridium-Quality items
  • Master Angler: Void Salmon and Slimejack added to fishing.
  • Polyculture: Coffee Beans added as a crop.
  • Full Shipment: Coffee Beans, Void Mayonnaise, Mead added to Shipment List.
  • Sunflower now can be grown in the Summer.
  • Relationships: Gifting villagers on their birthday will no longer make your spouse jealous.
  • Jojo Co. Member of the Year: Achievement is obtainable even after starting the Community Center.

Price Adjustments

  • Animal products increased by 25%
  • Rancher profession effectiveness increased to 20% from 10%
  • Artisan profession effectiveness decreased to 40% from 50%
  • Blacksmith profession effectiveness increased to 50% from 25%
  • Blueberry price reduced to 50g from 80g.
  • Starfruit price reduced to 750g from 800g.
  • Cranberry price reduced to 75g from 130g.
  • Ancient Fruit price reduced to 550g from 750g.

Update 1.07

  • Legend: Fruit Trees produce higher quality fruits as they age (up to Gold)
  • Relationships: Maxed relationship no longer decay.

Update 1.06

  • No noteable achievement changes.

Update 1.05

  • Iridium spawn rate increased.
  • Relationship: Fixed Shane Event.
  • Fector's Challenge: No longer bugged.
  • Craft Master: Kegs now require oak resin to craft.
  • Craft Master: Bee Houses now require maple syrup to craft.
  • March 12th: Tub O' Flower recipe sold during Egg Festival in Spring as intended.

Update 1.04

  • Honey prices reduced to 100g from 200g.

Update 1.03

  • Rancher profession now affects animal artisan goods.

Update 1.02

  • Leah's Doppleganger fixed.
  • Pepper Popper recipe requires cheese now.

Update 1.01

  • No noteable achievement changes.
